page.title: 12COMMUNITY POLICING
page.content: This area is served from the Totton police station,built in 1968.There are about 60 policemen ,4 policewomen ,one for each shift,no police horses or dog handlers.Photographers and other specialists are drawn from the whole Hampshire area.It is a mixed area to police,most problems involve juvenile offenders in petty crimes,especially shoplifting.There are several police vehicles but,many use bicycles as they enable the policeman to be approached easily by the public,yet are faster than walking.There is a community policing policy for the area meaning that the same police are in the area. Much effort is put into improving public relations,eg.P.C Fenner has the job of liasing with and talking to schools.The motorway is policed by specialists in fast cars from the Lyndhurst police station.
